result.execSummary:
All charges against Richard D Swangstu in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard D Swangstu is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Richard D Swangstu in court in custody. Prosecuting Atty Daniel R. Hess appeared for State of Wisconsin. DE states he applied for SPD, was interviewd but didn't think he qualified. Court finds good cause, sets over preliminary hearing to 5-26-22 at 10:30am.

01:51 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Frank John Remington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
